claim: It is normally unnecessary to wear a coat in Hollywood in July.

supporting.text: Hollywood, located in Los Angeles, California, experiences warm summer temperatures in July, averaging around 85°F (29°C), making a coat unnecessary.

attacks.text: Hollywood, located in Los Angeles, California, experiences warm summer temperatures in July, averaging around 85°F (29°C), making a coat unnecessary.
Even in warm climates, evenings in Hollywood can drop to around 60°F (15°C), making a light coat or jacket necessary for some people.
Most people adapt to evening temperatures and do not require a coat for short exposure to cooler evening air.
Some individuals, such as the elderly or those with medical conditions, may feel cold even at 70°F (21°C) and require a coat.
Such cases are exceptions and do not represent the general population, for whom a coat is unnecessary in July in Hollywood.

supporting.text: The Mediterranean climate of Southern California ensures dry and sunny weather in July, reducing the need for outerwear like coats.
